answers.answer: You are lucky you made it to 37! There's not a whole lot you can do. Drink lots of water and put your feet up when you can. Notify your Dr as well since it could be a sign of something else especially if it's severe and/Ir came on suddenly. Best of luck x

Make sure you don't have swelling in your face as well. Be sure they check your urine for protein and check your blood pressure. Some swelling is normal in the final weeks but excessive swelling with other symptoms could be a sign of preeclampsia and your baby may need to come out sooner than planned.
thank you the swelling is not in my face just my ankles and hands but I will  consult with my doctor toilet him know what is going on .. Thank you for the advice !!

question: Hi ladies, I'm 37 weeks and just starting to notice swelling in my hands and feet could anyone tell me what causes this and what can I do to help prevent the swelling from exceeding worser..please help!
title: Swollen hands and feet..
